extendedInfo.description: NOT A FLIGHT INSTRUMENTNOT FOR NAVIGATIONA bare bones pressure altimeter just like the one in an airplane (except red, for some reason). There are no additional features: if an airplane altimeter doesn't do it, this app won't do it. Unless you count "being red" as a feature.Uses the pressure sensor in your Android device and the altimeter setting you provide to estimate your altitude. Don't have a pressure sensor? In that case, it pretends you're at sea level. Just to make it clear: this app won't show your altitude unless your device has a pressure sensor inside.New to altimetry? Check Wikipedia to learn more about altimeter settings (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Altimeter). Then check your nearest, most recent METAR (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/METAR) to learn the correct altimeter setting for your area.Instructions:Use the volume buttons to change your altimeter setting.Long-press anywhere to toggle debug information.Features:Kalman filter smooths out sensor noiseRequires no special permissions at allFree, no ads, code is public domain!RedLimitations:Imperial units only (feet, inches of mercury)Pressure altitude only: does not integrate GPS altitudeREDVisit the website to get the code for yourself!

reviews.title: Hmm
reviews.comment: That was a waste of space. Doesn\'t move. Don\'t even know what it shows. No options. Why feets? Feets always stinks, go metric! Minimum 1 star, no minus score?
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Plain and simple! I love it!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great UI. Compatibility lacks
reviews.comment: Does not work on Sony Xperia Tablet Z. Shows me at MSL
reviews.author: Rojer Dodger

reviews.title: Not good
reviews.comment: Drive and didn\'t budge after starting.
reviews.author: A Google User
